siteMetadata.title: A11yTalks
siteMetadata.subtitle: Virtual meet-up featuring speakers & conversations around digital accessibility

frontmatter.title: Automated Accessibility Testing in JavaScript Frameworks
frontmatter.subtitle: Mark Steadman
frontmatter.description: Automated testing for accessibility issues with axe-core is one of the best and most effective ways to catch up to 50% of accessibility violations. In this talk, we will take a look at the levels of testing needed from an automated perspective to ensure your content is accessible at a component level and an application-level using a working React application and the axe-core testing frameworks.

frontmatter.title: Accessibility in the Modern Digital Agency
frontmatter.subtitle: Adrián Bolonio
frontmatter.description: When we develop a new web application, we often put a lot of work on the design, on making it beautiful and usable. In other words, we want our web app to be effective, efficient, and satisfying for the user. But a lot of times we don’t think about the user experience for people with disabilities, including people with age-related impairments. Adrián will show us some testing tools, libraries, and techniques to increase the a11y test coverage of our code with a simple React application example.

frontmatter.title: Time Control in Web Accessibility
frontmatter.subtitle: Sergei Kriger
frontmatter.description: The time of plain web pages and dial-up internet is gone forever. We live in the world where our devices are able to simultaneously operate with tons of data. Tweets, notifications, alert messages, progress bars — all these components appear on the web page asynchronously, which makes the user experience more convenient than ever.

frontmatter.title: Traditional CMS vs. Headless CMS A11y Throwdown!
frontmatter.subtitle: Panel
frontmatter.description: Join us for a live discussion of how accessibility is impacted by using a traditional CMS vs. a headless CMS and what are the pros/cons of each when it comes to creating accessible sites and applications. We have Rachel Cherry from WPCampus, Preston So from Gatsby, Carie Fisher from Deque Systems, and Mike Gifford from Open Concept participating with Caitlin Cashin from Deque Systems moderating.
